column4: Whoa.  I need to spend more time on the ThinkWiki site.  There's all kinds of stuff there!
apt-cache show lyx.  Gives a listserv instead of a personal address.
i have no idea am just a user
Commas?
Quotation marks, you mean?
Totally understandable.  I wish I could do the same.  Darn psych...
why not just built a guest account for whoever gonna use your pc
I'm considering that.  Or maybe creating another user to own those files, and still let people use this one to save the hassle of logging out/in.
having a seperate account for guest is good idea. for you will be able to restrict them and restrict ava resources to them. You do not want them messing your config
Good point.  Any guides for how to restrict things to exactly what you want available?
i just use gnome add user. And then work from there
did you check thinkwiki
I'm pulling that up now actually.
I guess that's what the one project was for - Portland?
portland? I guess i still need to read more :)
I'm not sure of the name - it's a recently launched effort to make KDE and Gnome more compatible.
yah that would be great. rather then have gnomerc when using kde or kderc when using gnome
Ask every once in a while in #ubuntu-offtopic (that's where we handle the great-community-but-not-support... kind of stuff)
fair enough
